Legal_Issue: Whether the RPD's finding that the applicant did not receive a death threat was procedurally fair and reasonable
Application_Facts: The applicant claimed refugee status due to threats from individuals allegedly linked to police extortion in El Salvador
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the RPD's decision
Court_Ruling: The court found procedural unfairness and ordered the case returned to a differently constituted RPD for reconsideration
Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of persecution due to alleged threats from individuals linked to police extortion in El Salvador
Legal_Standard: Standard of review for procedural fairness is correctness; credibility findings are reviewed on reasonableness
Assessment_Factor: Omissions in IMM 5611, inconsistencies between forms, police reports, and oral testimony
Procedural_Issue: RPD did not allow applicant to explain discrepancies in evidence
Review_Standard: Correctness for procedural fairness; reasonableness for credibility
Credibility_Assessment: RPD made a negative credibility finding based on inconsistencies and omissions
Evidence_Used: IMM 5611 form, police reports, oral testimony
Application_Basis: Subjective and objective fear of persecution
Governing_Rule: Claimant must demonstrate subjective and objective fear of persecution
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of opportunity for applicant to address inconsistencies
Outcome: Decision quashed, matter remitted for reconsideration
Harm_Assessment: Risk of persecution if returned to El Salvador
Cause_Description: Alleged threats from individuals linked to police extortion in El Salvador
Evidence_Handling: Discrepancies relied upon without allowing explanation
Legal_Provision_Violated: Procedural fairness under the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Evidence_Assessment: Negative credibility finding based on unexplained discrepancies
Decision_Rationale: RPD violated procedural fairness by not allowing applicant to explain discrepancies
Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to permit applicant to respond to inconsistencies
Legal_Standard_Applied: Correctness for procedural fairness, reasonableness for credibility
